title: Improve warning message for deprecated attributes in "packages.yaml"
body:
The `deprecatedProperties` custom validator now also accept a function to compute a better error message for deprecated properties. This is used to improve the warning message for deprecated properties in "packages.yaml" files.

To show an example, before this PR:
```console
$ spack spec zlib
Input spec
--------------------------------
zlib

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Warning: the attribute "paths" in the "packages" section of the configuration has been deprecated [entry=CommentedMap([('openmpi@3.18.1', '/usr')])]
==> Warning: the attribute "paths" in the "packages" section of the configuration has been deprecated [entry=CommentedMap([('cmake@3.18.1', '/usr'), ('cmake@3.17.1', '/usr')])]
==> Warning: the attribute "paths" in the "packages" section of the configuration has been deprecated [entry=CommentedMap([('openssl@1.1.1', '/usr')])]
zlib@1.2.11%gcc@10.1.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell

```
after this PR:
```console
$ spack spec zlib
Input spec
--------------------------------
zlib

Concretized
--------------------------------
==> Warning: detected deprecated properties in /home/culpo/PycharmProjects/spack/etc/spack/packages.yaml
Activate the debug flag to have more information on the deprecated parts or run:

        $ spack config update packages

to update the file to the new format

zlib@1.2.11%gcc@10.1.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
```
if debug is active:
```console
$ spack -d spec zlib
```
